meanings.definition: The physical matter of which a person or thing consists.
meanings.sent1: The cake's substance was soft and moist.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the substance of different rocks.
meanings.sent3: The substance of the jello made it wobble comically.
meanings.sent4: Her words had no substance, like air.
meanings.sent5: The substance of the soup was so rich and flavorful.

meanings.definition: A particular kind of matter with uniform properties.
meanings.sent1: The substance of the medicine was bitter.
meanings.sent2: Chemists analyze the substance of various chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The substance of the paint made it glow in the dark.
meanings.sent4: His argument lacked substance, like a hollow shell.
meanings.sent5: The substance of the fabric was smooth and silky.

meanings.definition: The real physical matter of which a person or thing consists.
meanings.sent1: The substance of the building was sturdy and strong.
meanings.sent2: Biologists examine the substance of living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The substance of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His promise had no substance, like a fleeting dream.
meanings.sent5: The substance of the tree trunk was rough and textured.
